00028 // Template for dynamic array.  It supports:
00029 //  - shared ownership, via reference counting
00030 //  - single allocation on heap for entire structure (no internal indirection)
00031 //  - dynamic growth with infrequent reallocation
00032 //  - hiding "new" and "delete" from callers that may have redefined these operators
00033 //
00034 // This class integrates its own needed member variables within
00035 // the array itself.  This approach is very space efficient, as 
00036 // it avoids the overhead of a level of indirection; there is no
00037 // pointer to an internal, owned array.
00038 //
00039 // The tradeoffs to get these features are:
00040 //  - any method call that could cause re-allocation is static, 
00041 //    returning a (possibly new) location for the array object
00042 //  - one cannot call re-allocating methods if the object is shared
00043 //  - this class must never contain virtual methods (thus does its own reference counting)
00044 //  - the allocation mechanism delegates to a helper class
00045 //  - it is not typesafe for objects that cannot safely be moved around
00046 //    in memory or which have non-empty destructors (it is safe for basic
00047 //    types and most structs).
00048 //
00049 // Example:
00050 //      GisIntArray* ints = GisIntArray::Create();
00051 //      ints = GisIntArray::Append(ints, 7);
00052 //      GisInt32 moreInts [] = { 8, 9 };
00053 //      GisInt32 numMoreInts = sizeof(moreInts)/sizeof(moreInts[0]);
00054 //      ints = GisIntArray::Append(ints, numMoreInts, moreInts);
00055 //      int element = (*ints)[1];
00056 //      cout << "The second element is " << element << endl;
00057 //      GIS_SAFE_RELEASE(ints);
00058 
00059 /// \brief
00060 /// Abstract template class for defining dynamic arrays.
00061 /// 
00062 /// <span class="red_text"><b>WARNING:</b></span> This array uses a single memory allocation to store array elements
00063 /// and may re-allocate that memory when the array size needs to change.
00064 /// Therefore, do not keep pointers to array elements and avoid using 
00065 /// for objects which cannot be safely moved around in memory or which have
00066 /// non-empty destructors.
00067 template <typename T> class GisArray
00068 {
00069 public:
00070 
00071     /// \brief
00072     /// Create an empty array
00073     /// 
00074     /// \return
00075     /// Returns a GisArray pointer
00076     /// 
00077     static GisArray<T> * Create();
00078     /// \brief
00079     /// Create a dynamic array preallocated to a specific size
00080     /// 
00081     /// \param initialAlloc 
00082     /// Input initial size of the array
00083     /// 
00084     /// \return
00085     /// Returns a GisArray pointer
00086     /// 
00087     static GisArray<T> * Create(GisInt32 initialAlloc);
00088     /// \brief
00089     /// Create a dynamic array from a pointer to a fixed array
00090     /// 
00091     /// \param elements 
00092     /// Input pointer to array of elements
00093     /// \param initialNumElements 
00094     /// Input number of elements to be added
00095     /// 
00096     /// \return
00097     /// Returns a GisArray pointer
00098     /// 
00099     static GisArray<T> * Create(const T* elements, GisInt32 initialNumElements);
00100 
00101     /// \brief
00102     /// Increase the reference count.
00103     /// 
00104     /// \return
00105     /// Returns the new reference count. For debugging use only.
00106     /// 
00107     inline GisInt32 AddRef() { return ++((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)this)->m_metadata.refCount; }
00108     /// \brief
00109     /// Decrease the reference count.
00110     /// 
00111     /// \return
00112     /// Returns the new reference count. For debugging use only.
00113     /// 
00114     inline GisInt32 Release() { if (0 != --((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)this)->m_metadata.refCount ) return ((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)this)->m_metadata.refCount; Dispose(); return 0; }
00115 
00116     /// \brief
00117     /// Retrieves the reference count.
00118     /// 
00119     /// \return
00120     /// Returns the existing reference count value.
00121     /// 
00122     inline GisInt32 GetRefCount() { return ((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)this)->m_metadata.refCount; }
00123 
00124     /// \brief
00125     /// Gets the number of items in the array.
00126     /// 
00127     /// \return
00128     /// Returns number of items in the array
00129     /// 
00130     GisInt32 GetCount() const { return ((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)this)->m_metadata.size; }
00131     /// \brief
00132     /// Get a pointer to the data in the array.
00133     /// 
00134     /// \return
00135     /// Returns a pointer to the data
00136     /// 
00137     T* GetData() { return (T*)(((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)this)->GetData()); }
00138     /// \brief
00139     /// Get a pointer to the data in the array.
00140     /// 
00141     /// \return
00142     /// Returns a pointer to the data
00143     /// 
00144     const T* GetData() const {return (const T*)(((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)this)->GetData()); }
00145 
00146     /// \brief
00147     ///  Resize the array.
00148     /// 
00149     /// \return
00150     /// Returns the new array pointer.
00151     /// 
00152     static GisArray<T> * SetSize(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 numElements);
00153 
00154     /// \brief
00155     /// Adds the specified array of items to the end of the array. Returns a new array pointer.
00156     /// 
00157     /// \param array 
00158     /// Input array pointer
00159     /// \param numElements 
00160     /// Input number of items to be added
00161     /// \param elements 
00162     /// Input pointer to array to append
00163     /// 
00164     /// \return
00165     /// Returns the new array pointer.
00166     /// 
00167     static GisArray<T> * Append(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 numElements, T * elements);
00168     /// \brief
00169     /// Adds the specified item to the end of the array. Returns a new array pointer.
00170     /// 
00171     /// \param array 
00172     /// Input array pointer
00173     /// \param element 
00174     /// Input item to be appended to array
00175     /// 
00176     /// \return
00177     /// Returns the new array pointer.
00178     /// 
00179     static GisArray<T> * Append(GisArray<T> * array, T element);
00180     /// \brief
00181     /// Removes all items from the array.
00182     /// 
00183     /// \return
00184     /// Returns nothing
00185     /// 
00186     void Clear();
00187 
00188     /// \brief
00189     /// Provide index operator [] access to array members.
00190     /// 
00191     /// \param i 
00192     /// Input index to access
00193     /// 
00194     /// \return
00195     /// Returns the value of the specified item in the array.
00196     /// 
00197     const T& operator[](int i) const { return GetValue(i); }
00198     /// \brief
00199     /// Provide index operator [] access to array members.
00200     /// 
00201     /// \param i 
00202     /// Input index to access
00203     /// 
00204     /// \return
00205     /// Returns the value of the specified item in the array.
00206     /// 
00207     T& operator[](int i) { return GetValue(i); }
00208 
00209 protected:
00210     /// Constructor
00211     GisArray() {}
00212 
00213     static GisArray<T> * AllocMore(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 atLeastThisMuch, bool exactly);
00214     static GisArray<T> * SetAlloc(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 numElements);
00215 
00216     /// Access elements
00217     const T& GetValue(GisInt32 i) const;
00218     T& GetValue(GisInt32 i);
00219     void SetValue(GisInt32 i, T newElement);
00220 
00221     /// the rest of GisIDisposable
00222     void Dispose();
00223 };
00224 
00225 template <class T>
00226 inline
00227 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::Create()
00228 {
00229     return AllocMore(0, 0, true);
00230 }
00231 
00232 template <class T>
00233 inline
00234 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::Create(GisInt32 initialAlloc)
00235 {
00236     return AllocMore(0, initialAlloc, true);
00237 }
00238 
00239 template <class T>
00240 inline
00241 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::Create(const T* elements, GisInt32 initialNumElements)
00242 {
00243     GisArray<T> * array = AllocMore(0, initialNumElements, true);
00244     if (array != NULL)
00245         array = (GisArray<T> *)GisArrayHelper::Append((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*) array, initialNumElements, (GisByte*) elements, sizeof(T));
00246     return array;
00247 }
00248 
00249 template <class T>
00250 inline
00251 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::Append(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 numElements, T * elements)
00252 {
00253     array = (GisArray<T> *)GisArrayHelper::Append((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*) array, numElements, (GisByte*) elements, sizeof(T));
00254     return array;
00255 }
00256 
00257 template <class T>
00258 inline
00259 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::Append(GisArray<T> * array, T element)
00260 {
00261     if ( ((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)array)->m_metadata.size == ((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)array)->m_metadata.alloc )
00262     {
00263         array = (GisArray<T> *)GisArrayHelper::AllocMore((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*) array, 1, false /*exactly*/, sizeof(T));
00264     }
00265     array->GetValue((((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*)array)->m_metadata.size)++) = element;
00266     return array;
00267 }
00268 
00269 template <class T>
00270 inline
00271 void GisArray<T>::Clear()
00272 {
00273     /// since no memory reallocation we can avoid input/output of array class pointer
00274     SetSize(this, 0);
00275 }
00276 
00277 template <class T>
00278 inline
00279 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::SetSize(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 numElements)
00280 {
00281     array = (GisArray<T> *)GisArrayHelper::SetSize((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*) array, numElements, sizeof(T));
00282     return array;
00283 }
00284 
00285 template <class T>
00286 inline
00287 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::SetAlloc(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 numElements)
00288 {
00289     array = (GisArray<T> *)GisArrayHelper::SetAlloc((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*) array, numElements, sizeof(T));
00290     return array;
00291 }
00292 
00293 //
00294 // Allocate some more memory for the array.
00295 // If the given array is NULL, a new array of zero size 
00296 // but the requested allocation is returned.
00297 // The returned array will always have at least one new
00298 // free element allocated. Thus, passing atLeastThisMuch < 1, 
00299 // while not an error, still results in some new storage.
00300 //
00301 template <class T>
00302 inline
00303 GisArray<T> * GisArray<T>::AllocMore(GisArray<T> * array, GisInt32 atLeastThisMuch, bool exactly)
00304 {
00305     array = (GisArray<T> *)GisArrayHelper::AllocMore((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*) array, atLeastThisMuch, exactly, sizeof(T));
00306     return array;
00307 }
00308 
00309 template <class T>
00310 inline
00311 void GisArray<T>::Dispose()
00312 {
00313     GisArrayHelper::DisposeOfArray((GisArrayHelper::GenericArray*) this, sizeof(T));
00314 }
00315 
00316 template <class T>
00317 inline
00318 const T& GisArray<T>::GetValue(GisInt32 i) const 
00319 {
00320     if (i >= GetCount() || i < 0)
00321         throw GisException::Create(GisException::NLSGetMessage(GIS_NLSID(GIS_5_INDEXOUTOFBOUNDS)));
00322 
00323     return *(this->GetData()+i); 
00324 }
00325 
00326 template <class T>
00327 inline
00328 T& GisArray<T>::GetValue(GisInt32 i) 
00329 {
00330     if (i >= GetCount() || i < 0)
00331         throw GisException::Create(GisException::NLSGetMessage(GIS_NLSID(GIS_5_INDEXOUTOFBOUNDS)));
00332 
00333     return *(this->GetData()+i); 
00334 }
00335 
00336 template <class T>
00337 inline
00338 void GisArray<T>::SetValue(GisInt32 i, T newElement) 
00339 {
00340     if (i >= GetCount() || i < 0)
00341         throw GisException::Create(GisException::NLSGetMessage(GIS_NLSID(GIS_5_INDEXOUTOFBOUNDS)));
00342 
00343     *(this->GetData()+i) = newElement;
00344 }
00345 
00346 /// \brief
00347 /// Dynamic array of bytes (GisByte).
00348 typedef GisArray<GisByte>   GisByteArray;
00349 
00350 /// \brief
00351 /// Dynamic array of doubles (GisDouble).
00352 typedef GisArray<GisDouble> GisDoubleArray;
00353 
00354 /// \brief
00355 /// Dynamic array of integers (GisInt32).
00356 typedef GisArray<GisInt32>  GisIntArray;
